document.full_text: from beijing in 1989 to tehran in 2009 to libya today, the tactic of dictators seems to be clear: shoot now and ask questions later. what happens when, as in china, they seem to get away with it?
document.title: way of the world: what happens when dictatorships actually succeed?
lines_and_colors: from beijing in 1989 to tehran in 2009 to libya today, the tactic of dictators seems to be clear: shoot now and ask questions later. what happens when, as in china, they seem to get away with it?
